subject: Sleep
title: Mania and Sleeplessness
description: A quick, practical guide to Mania and Sleeplessness.

hook.text: During mania, a person sleeps two hours and feels invincible. They don't feel tired. That's what makes it dangerous.

buildup.text: Manic episodes drastically reduce sleep need. Some patients go days with almost no sleep and feel energized.

discovery.text: Mania floods the brain with dopamine and noradrenaline, overriding the sleep homeostat's pressure to rest.

twist.text: Sleep loss itself can trigger mania. Pulling an all-nighter can push a stable bipolar patient into a manic episode.

climax.text: This bidirectional link makes sleep regulation the single most important lifestyle factor in managing bipolar disorder.

punchline.text: In bipolar disorder, losing sleep doesn't just follow mania. It causes it.

quiz.question: What is the relationship between sleep loss and mania?
options: Sleep loss can both follow and trigger manic episodes
Mania always improves with less sleep
